text: Thanks <@UJAPS2K4N>, I appreciate the insights. I'm not sure yet if it's worth "suffering" through that developer experience yet. Looks like some themes are profitable enough for it to be worth it

I’d advise leaving the css of modules open and the js of modules open. 

I’d have all your styling options set up in theme settings and use classes for that. 

Have a stylesheet that allows users to adjust that stuff
And then you need to be able to turn on and off your included js
That is what I would do if I wanted to make it less knowledgeable developer friendly.
Im not sure who your target audience is here, but I’d likely go along with Anton said. If you want to make your code accessible, using webpack and a while build process isn’t the way to go imo

Hello, as much as I love meeting new people and very... very... generous offers... I will need to respectfully decline as most of my time is tied up in collecting meme NFTs. However, I can inform you that your post is in violation of our code of conduct regarding soliciting services.

cc: <@UQNEXHW14>
